param.label: Reference
param.help: Reference sequence

param.name: forceGCcontentNormalization
param.label: Read Count (RC) correction for GC-content bias and low mappability
param.help: Set to 1 or 2 to correct the Read Count (RC) for GC-content bias and low mappability even when you have a control sample. - Default (WGS): 0 - Default (WES): 1
param.option: normalize the sample and the control RC using GC-content and then calculate the ratio "Sample RC/contol RC" (1)
model "sample RC ~ Control RC" bias, and then normalize for GC-content (2)

param.name: minCNAlength
param.label: Minimal number of consecutive windows to call a CNA

param.name: minimalSubclonePresence
param.label: Detects subclones present in x% of cell population
param.help: Default: 100 (meaning "do not look for subclones") Suggested: 20 for WGS and 30 for WES.

param.name: readCountThreshold
param.label: Threshold on the minimal number of reads per window
param.help: Threshold on the minimal number of reads per window in the control sample. Useful for exome-seq or targeted sequencing data. Default: 10 recommended value >=50 for for exome data.

param.name: window
param.label: Explicit window size
param.help: Higher priority than coefficientOfVariation. Ex: for whole genome sequencing: "50000"; for whole exome sequencing: "0"

param.name: step
param.label: Step
param.help: Used only when "window" is specified. Do not use for exome sequencing (instead set "0"). Ex: 10000

param.name: printNA
param.label: Print NA to avoid "-1"
param.help: Set "No" to avoid printing "-1" to the _ratio.txt files. Useful for exome-seq or targeted sequencing data.

param.name: noisyData
param.label: Noisy Data
param.help: Set "Yes" for target resequencing data (e.g., exome-seq) to avoid false positive predictions due to non-uniform capture

param.name: breakPointThreshold
param.label: Segmentation of normalized profiles (break point)
param.help: Positive value of threshold for segmentation of normalized profiles. Use something like 0.6 to get more segments (and thus more predicted CNVs).

param.name: breakPointType
param.label: Desired behavior in the ambiguous regions
param.option: the "unknown" region is attached to the "known" region on the right (0)
make a separate fragment of this "unknown" region and then attaches it to the left or to the right region choosing the longer one (1)
make a separate fragment of this "unknown" region and then attaches it to the left or to the right region but the "ploidy" copy number has a priority (2)

make a separate fragment of this "unknown" region and then attaches it to the left or to the right region choosing the longer one but this "known" region should make at least half-size of the "unknown" region (3)
make a separate fragment of this "unknown" region and do not assign any copy number to this region at all (4)

param.name: coefficientOfVariation
param.label: Coefficient of variation to evaluate necessary window size

param.name: contaminationAdjustment
param.label: Adjust sample contamination?
param.help: a priori known value of tumor sample contamination by normal cells. Set "Yes" to correct for contamination by normal cells. If "contamination" is not provided, it will automatically evaluate the level of contamination.

param.name: contamination
param.label: Sample contamination by normal cells
param.help: Ex: contamination=0.25

param.name: minMappabilityPerWindow
param.label: Minimal mappability per window
param.help: Only windows with fraction of mappable positions higher than or equal to this threshold will be considered (if "gemMappabilityFile" is not provided, one uses the percentage of non-N letters per window)

param.name: minExpectedGC
param.label: Minimal expected value of the GC-content
param.help: Minimal expected value of the GC-content for the prior evaluation of "Read Count ~ GC-content" dependency. Change only if you run Control-FREEC on a bacterial genome.

param.name: maxExpectedGC
param.label: Maximal expected value of the GC-content
param.help: Maximal expected value of the GC-content for the prior evaluation of "Read Count ~ GC-content" dependency. Change only if you run Control-FREEC on a bacterial genome.

param.name: ploidy
param.label: Genome ploidy
param.help: In case of doubt, you can set different values and Control-FREEC will select the one that explains most observed CNAs. Ex: 2 or 2,3,4

param.name: sex
param.label: Sample sex
param.help: "XX" will exclude chr Y from the analysis. "XY" will not annotate one copy of chr X and Y as a loss.

param.name: telocentromeric
param.label: Length of pre-telomeric and pre-centromeric regions
param.help: Control-FREEC will not output small CNAs and LOH found within these regions (they are likely to be false because of mappability/genome assembly issues). 50000 is OK for human/mouse genomes. Use smaller values for yeasts and flies. Do not set anything for exome-seq data.

param.name: mateOrientation_selector
param.label: Format of reads
param.help: If you specify orientation of your reads then only reads mapping in the corresponding orientation will be used for calculation of copy number profiles.

param.name: input_sample_file
param.label: Sample file
param.help: Sample file in .BAM format.

param.name: input_control_file
param.label: Control file
param.help: Control file in .BAM format.

param.name: input_capture_file
param.label: BED file with capture regions
param.help: Capture regions in .BED format.

param.name: BedGraphOutput
param.label: BedGraph Output for UCSC genome browser
param.help: Set "Yes" if you want an additional output in BedGraph format for the UCSC genome browser.

param.label: Visualize normalized copy number profile with predicted CNAs
param.help: Currently only human genomes are supported!
